arts.ttl: Ryan Shawcross makes Stoke City demand as he tackles big job question
arts.sum: But this was chalk and cheese, with Shawcross – in caretaker charge following the departure of Narcis Pelach – knowing that it was important to demand his team to go for the win and to create action, even if it risked defeat and the atmosphere was electric as Tom Cannon sealed a 1-0 win in injury time. The time might be in the future, it might be in years to come, but this is what I want to do.

arts.ttl: Championship roundup: Cannon fires Stoke past Sunderland, Rooney’s Argyle slump again
arts.sum: Blackburn and Watford’s promotion bids dented at home Swansea win late at home to Luton, Bristol City cruise Tom Cannon’s stoppage-time goal ended struggling Stoke’s long wait for a win in the Championship as they snatched a 1-0 victory over promotion-chasing Sunderland. Just when it looked as though the two teams would be settling for a point each, Cannon won it for Stoke at the death when he battled for possession before firing into the bottom corner from just outside the area. The Potters were under the caretaker charge of Ryan Shawcross after sacking Narcís Pelach on Friday, and the club great wildly celebrated what was their first win in 10 games. It lifted them four points clear of the relegation zone and it came following a superb performance in goal by Viktor Johansson, who produced a series of fine saves to thwart the visitors. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Sunderland as Tom Cannon brings down the house
arts.sum: Cannon struck in the third minute of injury time after a tight and at times fiercely-contested battle with Sunderland, seizing the ball back on the edge of the box and getting up to wallop past Anthony Patterson. Still, Sunderland maintained a danger even when they seemed on the back foot and Phillips touched a low Aouchiche cross onto his own post while the Potters had to defend a succession of corners – and Johansson, clearly fired up as skipper, was eager to seize any chance to take responsibility.

arts.ttl: Cannon blasts Stoke past Sunderland with last-ditch winner
arts.sum: Tom Cannon's stoppage-time goal ended struggling Stoke's long wait for a win in the Sky Bet Championship as they snatched a 1-0 victory over promotion-chasing Sunderland.

arts.ttl: Last-gasp Tom Cannon goal snatches much-needed win for Stoke against Sunderland
arts.sum: Caretaker boss Ryan Shawcross wildly celebrated what was Stoke’s first win in 10 games.

arts.sum: Stoke City part company with head coach Narcis Pelach following a nine-game winless run.
